2021-05-02T15:56:08Z: And that's it from us! We'll see you for next weekend's Spanish GP at Barcelona. Enjoy the rest of your day!
2021-05-02T15:55:26Z: Here's the Portuguese GP race report: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/portuguese-gp-hamilton-passes-verstappen-bottas-to-win/6501246/
2021-05-02T15:54:32Z: The Ferrari sparkling wine has been on the podium more times this year than the drivers.
2021-05-02T15:51:38Z: I wonder how many times in the past three years we've had a Hamilton-Bottas-Verstappen podium? I'm sure someone out there has a tally...
2021-05-02T15:43:15Z: Verstappen's had his hot lap deleted - track limits! So, the point belongs to Bottas...
2021-05-02T15:40:48Z: Ocon and Alonso tie up another double-points finish for Alpine, as Ricciardo and Gasly complete the scorers.
2021-05-02T15:40:10Z: Bottas completes the podium, with Perez completing the top four. Norris keeps fifth, with enough in reserve over Leclerc - who finishes sixth.
2021-05-02T15:39:10Z: Bottas HAD set the fastest lap, but Verstappen snatches it from the Finn's grasp by just over a hundredth of a second!
2021-05-02T15:38:22Z: And he does it - Lewis Hamilton wins the Portuguese Grand Prix!
2021-05-02T15:38:13Z: Bad to worse for Sainz now as he drops out of the points after being passed by Gasly for P10 a lap later at the same place Ricciardo got by. After an encouraging Saturday, things have not gone to plan on Sunday for Sainz.
2021-05-02T15:37:35Z: Hamilton, meanwhile, is only focused on tying up this win...
2021-05-02T15:36:57Z: Verstappen now pits, aiming to give Red Bull more ammo in the fight for the fastest lap - which he'll hope to take on the final lap.
2021-05-02T15:36:47Z: Here comes Ricciardo - easy as you like. Poor Sainz is struggling now, as he loses another place with the Australian driver moving up to P9 at the first turn. It has been a good recovery effort by the McLaren driver having started P16.
2021-05-02T15:35:31Z: Bottas gets the call to come in, taking on the softs to reclaim control of the fastest lap.
2021-05-02T15:34:06Z: Lapping cars out of the way, Schumacher can resume his tussle with Latifi. The Williams driver locks up at Turn 3 which rather gifts the overtake to Schumacher but he'll take it with glee to move up to P17.
2021-05-02T15:33:05Z: Perez, meanwhile, gets told to take another shot at a quick lap to stop Bottas from entering the free pitstop window.
2021-05-02T15:31:48Z: Bottas gets told he might get the chance of a free stop if he pushes. Perez is a little too close at the moment to make it happen right now.
2021-05-02T15:30:47Z: Vettel is another fading fast in this race, as he is passed by Aston Martin team-mate Stroll for P13. Six laps to go.
2021-05-02T15:29:30Z: As Mazepin found out earlier, the blue flags are there for a reason, but they have just disrupted a great tussle between Latifi and Schumacher. The pair are forced to pause their fight to allow both Alonso and Sainz to lap them.
2021-05-02T15:27:57Z: Sainz, on aging medium tyres that are really hurting his pace now, is powerless to stop Alonso barging by at the first corner with the help of DRS. Alonso is up to P8.
2021-05-02T15:27:22Z: Norris is 11.5s behind Perez as it stands, with Leclerc a further 3.6s back. Not all safe for Norris, as he's gone longer on a softer compound.
2021-05-02T15:25:26Z: Giovinazzi, who has had a quiet race since his early collision with his team-mate, charges ahead of Vettel with the aid of DRS on lap 56. That puts the Italian up to P12.
2021-05-02T15:24:09Z: Perez does a 1m20.643s now, taking the fastest lap so far on his soft tyres.
2021-05-02T15:23:40Z: Verstappen's now gapping Bottas, as the Finnish driver says he's losing power over the radio.
2021-05-02T15:22:33Z: After a scruffy couple of laps earlier, Gasly is back in the groove and is hunting down Ricciardo for 10th place. He has just got within one second of the McLaren driver.
2021-05-02T15:20:40Z: Perez is now given license to chase after the fastest lap. Hamilton's 1m20.933s is the benchmark.
2021-05-02T15:19:16Z: Perez now stops, taking on the soft tyres as Verstappen started to edge closer to his team-mate. The Mexican rejoins in fourth.
2021-05-02T15:19:06Z: Yep, it was coming. Mazepin has been given a five-second time penalty for holding up Perez earlier. Seems fair.
2021-05-02T15:18:18Z: Good afternoon Fernando Alonso. The Alpine driver blasts by Ricciardo into the first corner on lap 51 to take ninth place.
2021-05-02T15:17:34Z: Perez is now beginning to ail a little bit, and Hamilton clears the Red Bull to reclaim the lead of the Portuguese Grand Prix.
2021-05-02T15:16:47Z: Gasly's pace has dropped badly over the last lap or two, as he loses positions to both Ricciardo and Alonso. The AlphaTauri driver's last lap was around three seconds slower than his rivals and he is now out of the points in P11.
2021-05-02T15:15:19Z: Perez being blocked by Mazepin is now under investigation.
2021-05-02T15:14:08Z: Mazepin has been placed under investigation for ignoring blue flags after that incident with Perez. The Russian driver could be in trouble here.
2021-05-02T15:13:07Z: After the round of stops for those going longer in the first stint, Ricciardo is 2.2s ahead of Alonso running in the final points place. Both have got ahead of Vettel who has somewhat faded as the race has go on.
2021-05-02T15:12:22Z: Mazepin's...recalcitrance, let's call it, cost Perez a couple of seconds on the previous lap. Hamilton's now 4.5s behind.
2021-05-02T15:09:04Z: At the start of lap 44 Ocon makes the move on Sainz. With the aid of DRS, Ocon keeps it pinned around the outside of the Ferrari at the first corner to claim seventh place.
2021-05-02T15:08:28Z: Bottas even gets a message from up high, as Toto Wolff tries to gee up his driver to clear Verstappen.
2021-05-02T15:07:29Z: Hamilton now responds to Bottas with a 1m21.380s, and is now within 10s of leader Perez - who is still yet to pit.
2021-05-02T15:06:49Z: Bottas has picked up the pace now, setting a new fastest lap at the end of lap 42 with a 1m21.407s.
2021-05-02T15:06:34Z: Having released Ferrari team-mate Leclerc a few laps ago, Sainz is now fending off pressure from Ocon in the Alpine. That's a fight for seventh place after Alonso and Ricciardo pitted ahead.
2021-05-02T15:05:57Z: Ricciardo takes the hard tyres, after a bit of a slow stop with a sticky front-right wheel. He comes out 10th, ahead of Alonso.
2021-05-02T15:05:11Z: Hamilton lays down a 1m21.494s on his new boots, a new fastest lap.
2021-05-02T15:04:36Z: Alonso now pits from sixth, taking on the hard tyre for the remainder of the race. He comes out behind Gasly, but ahead of Vettel in that midpack.
2021-05-02T15:00:48Z: As we alluded to earlier, the fun we hoped for might have been manufactured by Ferrari, as Leclerc gets the easiest overtake of his life to pass Sainz for P9. Fair to assume that one was radioed.
2021-05-02T15:00:22Z: Perez is now leading, then, and looks set to be going long on his tyres to maybe get softs towards the end.
2021-05-02T14:59:36Z: Hamilton now pits for the hard tyre, getting a much better run off the pitlane, and stays ahead of the Red Bull.
2021-05-02T14:58:59Z: Just ahead of Bottas coming out of the pits, Russell retakes a position from Williams team-mate Latifi under braking at the first turn. Action everywhere you look!
2021-05-02T14:58:46Z: Bottas responds to Verstappen, but his pitstop is a second slower. Although Bottas stays out ahead, Verstappen charges past at turn 5 to claim the position!
2021-05-02T14:56:59Z: Verstappen cashes in his chips and elects to pit. Hard tyres for the Red Bull driver, and comes out in fourth - such is the gap to the rest.
2021-05-02T14:54:59Z: Ocon vs Gasly - Part 2. Aided by DRS Ocon blasts around the outside of Gasly at the first corner to take back that position he lost in the pits. That puts the Alpine driver up to P11.
2021-05-02T14:53:34Z: The pace at the front is beginning to rise, as the medium tyres still seem to have some life in them. If they can keep that going, they might prefer a later switch to softs instead...
2021-05-02T14:52:35Z: Leclerc, currently in P10, is finding good pace on the hard tyres and is closing up to Ferrari team-mate Sainz who is on the mediums. So that could be fun a little later.
2021-05-02T14:50:49Z: It's now a 1m21.934s for Hamilton that time around, as he continues to break-build like a top-class snooker player.
2021-05-02T14:50:01Z: Russell, who was a bit of a sitting duck on aging tyres, pits for Williams to drop to P18. It looked like quite a slow stop as he comes out just ahead of team-mate Latifi, who needs no second invitation and overtakes his team-mate a lap later.
2021-05-02T14:48:36Z: Bottas is being told he'll stop first out of the two Mercedes when the gap gets to 3.5s behind Hamilton. That might be soon - as it's now 3.3s.
2021-05-02T14:46:17Z: Hamilton ends lap 28 by going even faster, however, dropping a 1m21.995s. He's now 3s up on Bottas.
2021-05-02T14:45:33Z: A personal best for Leclerc that time around, so the hards seem to be coming in nicely.
2021-05-02T14:44:20Z: Hamilton drops a 1m22.138s for the fastest lap, clearly struggling out there on his worn mediums.
2021-05-02T14:43:18Z: Leclerc now pits from P5 to grab the hard tyre. That'll be keenly watched by the frontrunners.
2021-05-02T14:43:05Z: Gasly pits a lap later than Ocon and comes out ahead of him. That's a win for AlphaTauri as it will become a net eighth place once the pitstops shake out.
2021-05-02T14:41:09Z: A handful of the midfield runners have also pitted for the first time in this race - Ocon, Vettel, Giovinazzi and Tsunoda - to shuffle down the running order.
2021-05-02T14:39:30Z: Norris now takes his turn to pit, ditching the softs for a set of mediums to react to Sainz. McLaren took a second longer in the box, but Norris remains ahead of his former team-mate.
2021-05-02T14:37:56Z: Sainz ends his tenure on the soft tyre, coming in for a fresh set of mediums. A nice 2.2s stop there, and forms out behind Russell for P15.
2021-05-02T14:36:49Z: The gaps within the midfield are starting to stretch slightly as the drivers find the respective car performance levels. Gasly is the only one within one second of another driver, chasing fellow French driver Ocon for P8.
2021-05-02T14:34:25Z: My prediction was wrong! Hamilton grabbed DRS at the end of lap 19, and starts lap 20 by steaming around the outside of Bottas at Turn 1!
2021-05-02T14:32:19Z: Ricciardo must have a direct line to this live text commentary, as he responds immediately by charging around the outside of Vettel at the first corner at the start of lap 18.
2021-05-02T14:32:17Z: Hamilton dropped out of DRS range on that lap, having taken a wider line through Turn 13. But the slipstream still helped on the start-finish straight, bringing the British driver back into play.
2021-05-02T14:30:59Z: Honey Badger watch: Ricciardo is tucked up behind Vettel right on the cusp of the points-paying positions, but so far has not found a way past the Aston Martin driver.
2021-05-02T14:28:54Z: Norris has now been cleared by Perez, having hardly fought that one into Turn 1.
2021-05-02T14:28:49Z: Tsunoda gives no trouble to the track limits as he dives up the inside of Russell at Turn 5 to take 15th place.
2021-05-02T14:26:58Z: Norris is coming under increasing pressure from Perez, who feels Norris overtook him off-track. Sainz is now a further 2.5s off the pair.
2021-05-02T14:26:37Z: Many, many drivers being pinged for exceeding track limits at Turn 1. Tsunoda has been warned over his team radio he is already on the bubble having gone over the limits twice.
2021-05-02T14:25:06Z: Hamilton, having been fumbling with the keys for the past couple of laps, has finally unlocked the pace in that Mercedes - and he's going after Bottas now.
2021-05-02T14:23:46Z: The F1 stewards have decided no investigation is necessary for the clash between Raikkonen and Giovinazzi. That'll be one for the Alfa Romeo bosses to sort out after the race.
2021-05-02T14:22:26Z: Verstappen makes a slight error in that final corner, however, and this gives Hamilton a lovely tow into the first corner! The Mercedes is back in second, and keeps the Red Bull at bay.
2021-05-02T14:22:09Z: Ricciardo's recovery from his poor qualifying continues, with the McLaren driver up to 11th. Maybe he gained inspiration from fellow Aussie Jack Miller who won today's MotoGP race at Jerez. (Sorry for the spoilers).
2021-05-02T14:20:51Z: Turn 1 comes too soon for Verstappen this time around, who can't quite get enough of a draft on the leading Mercedes. Still very close, however.
2021-05-02T14:19:27Z: DRS has now been enabled - watch out for that playing a role in overtaking on the main straight.
2021-05-02T14:19:01Z: Verstappen's really close to Bottas now - so it seems that the Finnish driver's start might have inadvertently gifted Red Bull a chance at taking the lead...
2021-05-02T14:18:26Z: Russell loses another place at the start of lap 8, this time to Stroll, with the Williams driver now in 15th place.
2021-05-02T14:17:19Z: Leclerc gets ahead of Ocon to claim seventh place, while it was a poor restart for Russell who has dropped three places behind Ricciardo, Giovinazzi and Alonso.
2021-05-02T14:17:06Z: Hamilton got caught out and that let Verstappen steam past into turn 1! Sainz also lost out, allowing Perez and Norris to pass - and Norris cruises past Perez into turn 5! It's all happening.
2021-05-02T14:16:18Z: Bottas finally pulls the trigger and gets us underway!
2021-05-02T14:14:17Z: Safety car in this lap. We'll be up and running shortly.
2021-05-02T14:13:07Z: Giovinazzi looks to have not suffered too badly in the clash as he continues in P12 in the safety car train. Before the safety car came out, Ricciardo had made good progress and is now P13 right behind the Italian.
2021-05-02T14:11:24Z: Now that the debris has been cleared up from the start/finish straight, the safety car will no longer lead the field through the pitlane.
2021-05-02T14:11:20Z: Replays show Raikkonen closing up to the rear of Giovinazzi extremely quickly and in a jostling of racing lines the Alfa Romeos make contact on the main straight. The Finn's car loses its front wing which then lodges itself into his front wheels and it is race over.
2021-05-02T14:09:24Z: A replay of the start, then - Perez dropped behind Sainz after an iffy start. Ocon was passed by Norris, but the Frenchman got him back at Turn 5 to set up Norris's later overtake.
2021-05-02T14:07:04Z: The safety car is out – and Raikkonen is also out of this race having come to a stop at Turn 1.
2021-05-02T14:06:20Z: Ah, we may have cursed Raikkonen there! At the end of lap one he clashes with Alfa Romeo team-mate Giovinazzi on the main straight and loses his front wing.
2021-05-02T14:05:58Z: That's a cracking move from Norris, streaking around the outside of Ocon at turn 10 and claiming sixth! Lovely stuff.
2021-05-02T14:05:18Z: All very well behaved in the squabbling midfield with no major contact in the first few corners. Raikkonen, who took off like a rocket here last year, has already gained two places and is up to P13.
2021-05-02T14:04:35Z: And the Portuguese Grand Prix is go! Bottas keeps the lead from Hamilton, with Perez dropping behind Sainz off the line.
2021-05-02T14:03:27Z: Anyway, the cars are lining up. You could cut the tension with a front wing endplate...
2021-05-02T13:59:40Z: Row 9 is Little Canada, isn't it? Stroll and Latifi line up ahead of the Haas duo.
2021-05-02T13:58:52Z: We've got Sainz, Ocon, Norris, Gasly, Vettel, Stroll and Raikkonen on softs - everyone else starts on mediums.
2021-05-02T13:58:02Z: We've got lots of elevation at this circuit, hopefully it yields a rollercoaster of a race.
2021-05-02T13:52:58Z: Somewhat further down the grid is a Mr. D. Ricciardo - who's not going to just sit and accept P16 on the grid. Expect a charge of some kind.
2021-05-02T13:51:34Z: The risk of rain currently is at 0%. Air temp is at 20 degrees C, and the track temp is almost double that. There's your weather report for this encounter.
2021-05-02T13:46:50Z: Not pictured in the Portuguese national anthem band: the Casio keyboard someone's playing the main tune on.
2021-05-02T13:43:24Z: Carlos Sainz Jr, meanwhile, outqualified team-mate Charles Leclerc for fifth. Esteban Ocon was also impressive, taking sixth on today's grid ahead of Lando Norris, Leclerc, Pierre Gasly and Sebastian Vettel.
2021-05-02T13:42:32Z: Bottas hurled his W12 on pole yesterday, edging Hamilton and denying the Brit his 100th pole. But the Red Bulls are on the next row, and so it could be a real battle royale...
2021-05-02T13:41:16Z: At the front, Mercedes and Red Bull are looking like they'll be on different strategies. More on that here: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/how-f1-tyre-strategy-differences-could-decide-the-portuguese-gp/6500940/
2021-05-02T13:40:23Z: It's only the second time F1's been to Portimao in a racing capacity, and it's a circuit which seems to throw the generally considered tyre hierarchy out of the window. It'll be interesting to see what happens...
2021-05-02T13:36:35Z: Hello everyone - it's almost time! Just 25 minutes until lights out at the Algarve International Circuit ahead of the Portuguese Grand Prix.
